heading: Expungement Eligibility Criteria
introText: You may be eligible for expungement in New Jersey if:

listPoints.title: Disorderly Persons Offenses and Petty Offenses
listPoints.description: Eligible after a waiting period of 5 years.

listPoints.title: Indictable Offenses (Felony Convictions)
listPoints.description: May be expunged after 10 years, though eligibility is stricter.

listPoints.title: Completion of Sentences
listPoints.description: All sentences, probation, and fines must be fully completed.

listPoints.title: Ineligible Offenses
listPoints.description: Certain serious crimes like murder, kidnapping, sexual assault, and offenses committed by public officials are not eligible for expungement.
